title: Publications
text:
Faas, Thorsten, and Anton Könneke. 2021a. “The Rise and Fall of Polls?” FES Impuls, 1–5.


———. 2021b. “Wählen Mit 16 - Pro Und Contra [Voting at 16 – Pros and Cons].” Aus Politik Und Zeitgeschichte, no. 38-39: 29–35.


———. 2022. “Wählen ab 16? Pro und Contra [Voting at 16? Pros and Cons].” In Repräsentation - Identität - Beteiligung: zum Zustand und Wandel der Demokratie, edited by Anne-Sophie Friedel, Julia Günther, Jacob Hirsch, Sascha Kneip, Johannes Piepenbrink, and Anne Seibring. Schriftenreihe / Bundeszentrale für politische Bildung, Band 10871. Bonn: Bundeszentrale für Politische Bildung.


———. 2023. “Integrationsfunktion in Zeiten der Fragmentierung? [Integration in Times of Fragmentation].” Zeitschrift für Parteienwissenschaften 2023 (1): 123–34. https://doi.org/10.24338/MIP-2023123-134.


———. 2024. “Nicht Nur Anders, Sondern Auch Weniger - Politische Informationsversorgung Im Wandel Der Generation Und Der Medien Am Beispiel Der Bundestagswahl 2021 [Not Only Different, but Also Less - Political Information Provision in the Changing Generation and Media Using the Example of the 2021 Bundestag Elections].” In Im Land Der Scheinriesen? Die Bundestagswahl 2021 in Der Analyse, edited by Ursula Münch, Heinrich Oberreuter, and Jörg Siegmund, 77–92. Campus.


Faas, Thorsten, Anton Könneke, and Arndt Leininger. 2021. “Wählen Mit 16 [Voting at 16].” In Parlamentarische Demokratie Heute Und Morgen - Erwartungen, Herausforderungen, Ideen, edited by Hendrik Hering. Frankfurt am Main: Wochenschau Verlag.

title: Anton Könneke
text:
I am a Mres/PhD student at the Department of Government at the London School of Economics and Political Science. Broadly, I want to understand how interest aggregation and feelings of powerlessness are related and how they can be decoupled. My supervisors are Florian Foos and Mathias Poertner.
My PhD thesis focuses on political representation and direct interactions between citizens and representatives. I explore whether face-to-face interactions between citizens and agents of the representative system facilitate mutual learning and increases in perceived system responsiveness. My research draws on field experiments, survey research and causal inference more generally. I enjoy collecting, analysing and visualising all kinds of data including survey, text, and spatial data.
During my undergraduate and graduate studies in Berlin worked as a research assistant to Thorsten Faas at the Center for Political Sociology of Germany, where I co-authored several publications.
